com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.cdr

Interface ConflictResolutionUserExit

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CRUserExitSample

    public interface ConflictResolutionUserExit
    When a conflict is detected, you can resolve the conflict by invoking a customized user exit class. This class allows you to define a conflict resolution strategy that is not covered by one of the standard resolution methods (source wins, target wins, largest value wins, or smallest value wins). The user exit class can resolve the conflict by returning a row that will be applied to the target table. All Conflict Resolution user exit classes must implement this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean resolveConflict(ConflictResolutionUserExitControl control, com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF beforeImage, com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF afterImage, com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF targetImage, com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF desiredImage)
      This method specifies how the conflict is to be resolved.

    • Method Detail

      • resolveConflict

        boolean resolveConflict(ConflictResolutionUserExitControl control,
                        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF beforeImage,
                        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF afterImage,
                        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF targetImage,
                        com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.DataRecordIF desiredImage)
                 throws ConflictResolutionUserExitException
        This method specifies how the conflict is to be resolved.
        Parameters:
        control - Information about the publisher and subscriber.
        beforeImage - The row's column values that we expect to find in the target table before we apply changes to the row. The object will be null if it is not applicable.
        afterImage - The row's column values that we would have applied to the target table if there were no conflict. The object will be null if it is not applicable.
        targetImage - The row's column values that we actually found in the target table when the method was called. The object will be null if it is not applicable.
        desiredImage - The column values that will be applied to the target table row. If the method returns true, these values are subsequently applied to the target table. This parameter applies only to conflicts caused by rows being inserted or updated in the source table. For row deletes, do not assign column values to this object. The object will be null if it is not applicable.
        Returns:
        true if the conflict should be resolved by using the desiredImage.
        Throws:
        ConflictResolutionUserExitException - When an error is encountered during processing.
